page.title: 15COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: The{Radio Electrical Tower,}263' high, was erected in 1960 with 2 dish aerials but now has 14. It receives and transmits being part of a network of 200 towers in England which provide a communication system. The adjacent building houses an emergancy generator The{Sub Post Office}has sorting facilities and employs 1 post man and 2 post ladies who start work at 6.30 am. dealing with the mail brought by van from Cambridge. The second delivery arrives about 1 pm. to be sorted. Bicycles are used to deliver mail, twice daily but only once oon Saturdays. There are 4 pillar boxes, one on the vicarage wall being Victorian. Three{Public Telephone}boxes are to be found in the village.
